Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin,good location,clean,staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: helenhall767
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a fantastic holiday to rome with my mum.I was really concerned about the reviews but should not have been as the hotel was in a good location.The room was clean and had an excellent shower.The room was serviced each day,clean towels each day,bins emptied and beds made.The breakfast included cereal,scrambled egg,ham,cheese,croissants etc.The staff were very helpful and cheerful.The only thing that is worth knowing is that the hotel is on three separate locations and we were dropped off at the wrong one,however,it was a short walk to the nearby by center 2. The staff recommended a restaurant which was a couple of minutes walk away IL TEMPIODI MINERBA,56/58,VIALE MANZONI.The food was so good and reasonably priced that we eat there each night.All in all the best holiday ive ever had.Do not be put off by the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hagshur
Reviews.Content: Bad location rooms with strange smell Breakfast very limited but overall for coming to see Rome and not the hotel, only for slipping It was ok

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend Centre 3 for families (quarduple room).”
Reviews.Author: Alkistis_Bozov
Reviews.Content: Receptionists overall are rude (except one gentleman during the evening shift). Hotel is not convenient for families with babies, quarduple room is at the 4th floor, elevator (the slowest one in the world) goes up to 3rd. Then one has to carry luggage, prams, kids etc and "crawl" the narrow steps. They don't inform about this. Room is overall good. Spacious bathroom, but be careful, do not open bathroom's window, it is dangerous for kids. Breakfast is ok, the guy serving breakfast is polite. Don't eat the ham, it is terrible. I regret I didn't pay 20 or 30 euros more to go to a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Run away!”
Reviews.Author: Uri_fa
Reviews.Content: Very rude staff except for one nice young woman. Horrible location, very scary area. The pictures on their site do not show the reality. Noisy. We were devastated on arrival but the hotel was prepaid by the agent. We had no choice but to stay there. Run away!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY ! WORST HOTEL EVER !”
Reviews.Author: pcfixer077
Reviews.Content: Have booked this hotel through Flight Center but was a huge mistake.Arrived from Paris after 12 hours on train ,got here around 10 pm to find this s..t hole.No power in the room at arrival,hot evening and the size of the room,NO EXAGERATION, a prison cell. I demanded a better room but I was told is nothing availableu until next day ,Rud staff and non-professional.Amateurs. Internet never worked only around the Reception area. If you ever get close to this hotel click BACK button and run.If you are already staying wear garlic at night.It might bit the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude and nasty staff, don’t recommend saying there!”
Reviews.Author: Israeli35
Reviews.Content: The front desk assistance was HORIBLE ( beside one nice young man ) all the rest of the front desk people where impatient, rude, and just plain mean to us. The location although somewhat close to the metro station is a slum, in the room the heat was ether not working ( December!!! ) or too hot, you cannot control the AC but have to call front desk! And they are very rude and impatient, the blankets where really old and thin so you needed 4 to warm up and it was too heavy to sleep with. If I knew how bad it would be I would have defiantly paid twice the money and stayed in a much better hotel in the center of Rome

Reviews.Title: “One hotel but 3 locations - potentially confusing”
Reviews.Author: Polly255344
Reviews.Content: I had booked an additional night at the Center Hotel , to follow on after a small group tour booking. On checking in, I was told I had the same room for both nights, then about 10 mins later, I was told I would need to change rooms for the second night, then by that evening, I was told I would need to change to another of the Center hotels around the corner. It was all pretty inconvenient. The rooms were hot, and you have to ask for the airconditioning (and the TV) to be activated by reception. The locality is grubby and riddled with graffiti, and there's quite a bit of train and tram noise, but otherwise it was OK for a short/cheap stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location - would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: helenagee
Reviews.Content: the hotel is no more than 10 minutes from termini, (walk left straight out of the station). the hotel was very clean, we had fresh towels etc.. everyday. and the staff were really friendly, they gave us a good map when we checked in and told us the best way to get to the attractions. its in a good location and the easiest station is Manzoni. on the first night without the map we found the colloseum is only a 15 minute walk straight down the road, and the breakfast was nice in the mornings and just round the corner to the left are some good restaurants. i think some people who maybe aren't used to walking think it feels alot further away than it is from stations etc.. but my boyfriend and I are in our 20's and found the distance perfect. some of the back streets might be a bit grubby but what city doesnt have them? i would definitely recommend this hotel. the only thing i would say is to take a small mirror with you, as the only one i the room is in the bathroom, which isnt always easy when you're both getting ready to go out! one tip: go to the vatican for 8am, there are no queues at this time!

Reviews.Title: “Easily, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: hasisme
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, but here it is. I stayed here six months ago. The hotel was dark and somewhat dirty, The room reeked of raw sewage. There was a sign in the room that stated in three languages to call the front desk if there was a "suspicious intruder in your room" -sounds made up, but this is the truth. The staff seemed uncaring and did not offer to carry my suitcase to my room. The gave me directions to the room and i found it without issue. The hallways are dark and have motion detectors in them. Best of all, the hotel is located 15-20 minutes down the street (but across) from the Rome Termini. You have to walk through a grungy neighborhood to get through it. I work in Detroit, so I wasn't scared, but others may find the walk intimidating. Do not make this walk late at night under any circumstances...take a taxi if it is dark out.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay & I'm a fussy american”
Reviews.Author: 2retiredpeople
Reviews.Content: Great location by the train station and metro even though you have to walk a bit (10 minutes). Room was cleaned every day, clean towels, gave you shampoo/soap/new towels every day, shower is a little tricky because it's teeny tiny (has great water pressure) but I'm 56 years old & fussy and I thought it was fine, wonderful continental breakfast, great staff, felt very safe even when walking at night. Even though we were in Hotel Center 2 (around the corner from Hotel Center 1) it was absolutely perfect for what we needed and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for overnight stay in Rome Termini”
Reviews.Author: VitPetersburg
Reviews.Content: This is relatively good located hotel for the guests who are passing by Rome, as we were. It is close to Rome Termini RC as the hotel ca 500 meters away from the station itself and is easy reached by walking. We needed overnight stay for Rome before heading to the South of Italy and Hotel Center 123 passed OK to the task with relatively good value - booked by booking.com. There are some strange points about the hotel though - the staff at night not extremely friendly, yet it may be due to some language luck as the day portiere was pleasant and very helpful . Your hotel may be one out of three buildings (we actually stayed at #3 Hotel) and you do not know in advance which one is yours - do not rush to get in with you cases. The hotel we stayed (Hotel #3) in is reasonably clean state and has a lift to get to the floor with the luggage. Yet announced minibar and TV was not functioning - minibar is empty and off and for TV remote you need to leave 20 euro deposit, which was funny enough. We have not used AC as it was not needed - no comments on this. The room itself is relatively poor with some vintage furniture inside, yet large enough for one night stay. However the bath room with shower inside is claustrophobic indeed - you should be very careful in both bathroom and in shower cabin itself not no hurt yourself. Breakfast is Rome simple - some sweet rolls, hot drinks and juices at the lovely terrace overlooking the backyard garden. You may book the day trips and bus excursions from the reception, which is almost standard at any Rome hotel. Overall the value is OK for single night stay with nothing to die for.

Reviews.Title: “not at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkbb28
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid in advance from australia through a travel agent. Arrived at hotel after walking for 20 minutes to be told. " No you are not at this hotel but at our other hotel. Go out the door walk down the street and turn the corner." "You will be there in 10-15 minutes walking."Yes they have more than one hotel. They over book and then refer you onto their other hotels. We were not told this!. They charge for a remote for the tv. The aircon doesn't work. The room had not been cleaned as the previous occupants baggage tags were lying on the floor in the corner. Needless to say we did not stay. Left and found another hotel even though we had paid for 4 nights in advance. Check which hotel you are booked into 1 2 3 or whatever. !!

Reviews.Title: “Con artists”
Reviews.Author: simp3leone
Reviews.Content: With good intent the travel agent made out reservations, believing info she had been given by the hotel. It is in the very dingy, dirty,dark part of a town. Disinterested reception staff pushed us to another of their hotels around the corner at 10.30 at night. Air conditioning not working but would not commit to having it fixed. We walked out after pre-paying Aus$400 for two nights and checked into another hotel (Donatello) around the corner without even bothering to notify center 123. They didn`t deserve that consideration. We have advised our travel agent to remove them from any advisory system they have. Tbhere is only one restaaurant within walking distance. Book in nearer front entrance to Terminii station , say on via Cavour. Remember to do all your tourism research before you get to Rome because there are NO information offices in Rome at all. bDo All your homework before you leave home.They just want your money and would rather you left it in a bag and just left the town .

Reviews.Title: “Center Hotel 3”
Reviews.Author: dalmatiansissi
Reviews.Content: take bus 105 (sometimmes it can be very crowded; and once my girlfriend got harassed by a group of 18 years old pocketpickers) from Roma Termini for 4 stops, you are right beside the door of Center Hotel 3. The receptionists are several grandpas, speak some English (at least one can communicate with them), very friendly and helpful. We took their suggestions on the restaurants nearby, dropped our luggage in their cabinet for half a day after check-out, got advised how to take the bus to go around Rome. Yes, they were just like the sweetest Grandpa, which made us feel warm. Absolutely compliment on that! However unfortunately the rooms in Center 3 are not really good, tiny, old, and you don't want to enter the bathroom without slippers. But you get for what you pay. €50/night for a double room, is probably the cheapest you can find in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel - but location was convenient and staff were friendly”
Reviews.Author: scottcabal
Reviews.Content: Put simply - this is not a great hotel.... i'd probably rate it averageish. We booked here because we were lucky to get anything in Rome for the price we needed. However for what it is it's not too bad, and the stay was acceptable, despite the rooms. We stayed at the start of June when there was a United Nations conference going on in the city. 2500 people booking out many city centre hotels completely meant a lack of rooms anywhere. We had to go on those same days but by the time that we booked there really wasn't much available. We booked the Hotel Center after reading reviews on here. I thought it looked ok - but it was basically either a hotel of this genre or something ridiculously expensive which we couldn't afford. We got to the hotel mid afternoon and they let us check straight in. The check in staff were nice and friendly and they let us go straight up to the hotel. On a morning they were also nice and friendly when going to breakfast (a simple buffet). They were also nice and friendly when returning late at night and pestering them to get your key from the office (they need to be left but the office is open 24 hours). However the disappointment was the rooms. We had one double and one single room. The double wasn't too bad. The bathroom door had been broken by a guest and repaired - an amateur job but it worked. It was also missing the remote for the TV and the curtains but other than that it was ok. The single room however was a little worse. The wall alongside the bed had obviously been damp or covered in mould at some time by the look of it, there was some mould on the ceiling of the bathroom too and it was really small. However nothing really caused a problem we just took it as it was. Breakfast is a simple continental buffet - bread/toast, ham, cheese, cakes, cereal, yoghurt, tea / coffee etc. It's basic but filling and available from 7am which helps for getting into the city to see the sights. Location wise the hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the Termini station. The direct route isn't desirable at night as it's badly lit but just walk one block down the road next to the hotel and walk up there to the station and it's well lit. It's also only 20 minutes walk from the colosseum and around the corner from many nice restaurants. Overall this hotel wasn't bad considering all of the circumstances, but I would recommend looking elsewhere if you get a chance. If you book here it's a good enough hotel - as long as you're prepared for it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer satisfaction- zero!”
Reviews.Author: cath_85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February of this year and found the staff to be completely incompetent and unhelpful, bordering on downright rude at times (save for one friendly guy who only seemed to work during the day and so we never saw much of him, but he was always very cheerful and pleasant). The television which we had paid a deposit for was broken and despite daily promises from hotel staff that it would be fixed, it never was. The lights are on some sort of sensory device where they only turn on when people walk past them, not always very safe as there are quite a few steps and different levels and if your eyesight is not that great in the dark I wouldn't recommend it. I really did not feel very safe walking about at night in the area where the hotel was situated (right opposite the train station) and got taxis to and from the center after dark. It is also quite a walk from the the centre of Rome and we often found it very tiring walking back after being out all day as it is on a slight incline from the centre (fine if your fit enough I might add). The really poor thing I found about this hotel was the complete lack of any customer satisfaction. We tried to lodge a complaint against a member of staff who had literally bawled at us for changing our check-out date due to our flight into Rome being cancelled at the last minute (when we phoned the hotel from our home in Scotland we were assured that this would be no problem yet when we arrived at the hotel they claimed this not to be the case and we had to pay cash in hand for the room again when we had already paid for it online), yet no one was at all interested and we felt like all they were concerned with was taking our money. I really wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, next time I go to Rome I will be going somewhere closer to the center oh and just a tip if you are staying in this area make sure not to get ripped off by taxi drivers as you get off the bus from the airport (it drops you off by the train station) agree a fare with the driver before you get in.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended at all”
Reviews.Author: kiwihopper
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my agent who booked it through a hotel website. I booked for 4 nights but ended up only staying 1 night. The hotel is more like a hostel although I have stayed in better hostels. When I had a shower in the tiny closet bathroom, I came out to find that my bedroom had flooded. When I complained to the reception, they said that this is a common mishap and after much persuasion on my behalf, gave me 3 handtowels to me to attempt to mop up the flood in my bedroom. I was a little bit distressed and wanted to call a friend from my room. The telephone did not allow me to call outside and when I told this to reception, they didn't believe me or offer any alternatives. The last straw was when I was trying to find a socket to charge my cellphone. None of the sockets worked and again, the reception did not believe me or come up to my room to try to help. I quickly got out of that "hotel" and checked into another hotel. I have yet to receive any refund on the 3 nights that I did not stay. I do not recommend staying at this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russlan
Reviews.Content: It is a very poor hotel. Poor location. Very noisy. Very shabby room (2 stars is a joke). Poor breakfast. Stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service..”
Reviews.Author: fizzlebottom
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Rome and stayed at Hotel Center 1 for 3 nights. The hotel location is off the tail end of the termini in what could be described as a grimey not too touristy area. Prepare for a 15 minute walk from the station to the front desk of hte hotel. The front desk service here appears to be run by older senior folk who do not know English at all. Although the rooms are clean, the walls are paper thin and noise from outside and from the lobby can flow in easily. Each hallway has motin detectors which turn on the hallway lights and each room has a vent which shines light from the hallways into each room. Therefore if someone comes back to their room at 3am, the hallways will light up and your room will get somw light too. This is not very good if you are trying to adjust to the jetlag and need some sleep. The morning breakfast is very continental, packaged crackers,buns, orange drink (not juice), and coffee. Bottom line, this is a no frills, you get what you pay for semi hostel type place..Proceed with caution..

Reviews.Title: “Charged for a 1 day check-in / check-out change 9 months in advance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is disgraceful that after paying for a booking 9 months in advance (travelling July 2006)a fee is charged for moving the check-in and check-out dates by 1 day with 48 hours of placing the booking and 9 months before travelling. Someone has the use of your money for 9 months yet no flexibility is applied. Be careful when you place online bookings. It is my first and last - former Expedia user.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, false advertising.”
Reviews.Author: anngaz
Reviews.Content: Very noisy room, unhelpful staff, poor facilities, poor location - to far from metro and attractions, breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain and location !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Center hotel in Rome is a little gem !! Staff always friendly, helpful. Great location near Termini and Cinquecento for public transportation access, great shopping nearby. Rooms very clean, great showers and just great for the price. Best cappuccinos in the morning on the terrace too. Best travels to you . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Hey you are in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: AvLouis
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to a lot of place in Europe and stayed from 1-4 star hotels and I am convinced that you will never find the same quality that we have in California. This hotel is a budget hotel and it shows. From the size of the TV to the paper thin walls. It is a hotel catering to the young/adult on a budget traveler. The beds are bouncy, the shower small, the staff helpful, but with different attitudes. The location is ideal to take the rail of bus ( a five minute walk). The entire facility was clean and our room made daily. Sheets and towels clean, TV channels are all in italian (but hey you are in italy), except to MTV and BBC. Breakfast was served by a very nice old lady and it consisted of milk coffe juice and bread with butter and jam. Very nice to stuff your self and save money, since food in italy is expensive. This hotel is not a place to stay and relax, it is a base from which to explore. It was safe at night, had a little store around the corner. I like this hotel because you can go to italy on a budget, but still go. I would recommend this hotel if you are in rome on a budget and will be out and about exploring the city. Comfy and cheap, clean too. The hotel serves it purpose...

HotelInfo.Name: Center Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giovanni Giolitti 443, 00185 Rome, Italy
